summary: Course introduction, overview of NLP applications, and expectations for COMP8420.
Basics of language models, tokenization, and data preprocessing techniques in NLP.
Foundation models in NLP — architecture, transfer learning, and applications of GPT/BERT.
Using large language models (LLMs) for text processing with libraries like Hugging Face and LangChain.
Multimodal LLMs — combining text, image, and other inputs for richer model capabilities.
Fine-tuning LLMs with a focus on parameter-efficient methods like Adapters and LoRA.
Understanding the risks, biases, and safety concerns in deploying large-scale LLMs.
Advanced applications: Humanoid AI and its intersection with LLM reasoning and interaction.
Designing, conducting, and interpreting evaluation metrics for NLP systems.
Team registration and project planning workshop — defining objectives and timelines.
Checkpoint: In-class Q&A on project ideas, clarifying dataset scope, and refining methodology.
Optional early presentations; final debugging, feedback loops, and polish for evaluation.
Final presentation workshop — showcasing working prototypes and summarizing project impact.
